properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 8 at 4:07AM PST until January 8 at 3:21PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...Flood Warnings continues for the following rivers in
Washington...

Satsop River Near Satsop affecting Grays Harbor County
Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County

No hydrologically significant precipitation in the forecast for the
next two days. Another front will arrive on Friday but snow levels
will be low, below 2000 feet, keeping the precipitation in the
form of snow in the mountains limiting runoff into the rivers.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Satsop River Near Satsop
* Until this afternoon.
* At  3:15 AM Wednesday the stage was 38.3 feet.
* Flood stage is 38.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river has crested and will continue to fall to below
flood stage this morning.
* Impact...At 38.0 feet, the Satsop River will flood low pasture lands
and some roads along the river.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.

NWSheadline: Flood Warning extended until this afternoon
